document.title: Archdiocese of Milwaukee Curriculum Guide, Grade 8

83552700E05C47F5A7A9911FEF0335D0.description:
Determine appropriate organizational structure for various types of writing based upon task, purpose, and
audience

88C321F207114C17BEEB42069C0C0BBC.description: Identify discipline-specific tasks, audiences, and purposes

681C8FF5E2AF4EB9BA7C73396749AE89.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

A799D6C2D02A4AF0835081E9E9F26AED.description: Reflect on key ideas and details as evidence of support and understanding

24C8DAD85A81445C9E73A4C137416E72.description: Analyze key ideas and details as evidence of understanding text

3E6D7DC63B6E4CEF93F02204AE5E633C.description: Draw evidence from key ideas and details as support for research

B5EA0C38C6534590839A55D96EC524AF.description: Cite textual evidence to analyze explicit text

3539803002124F7F8A0EDF19203BA043.description: Identify key ideas and details that support conclusions

813CB1DEB4FA4DBDA9AE85BA81E48261.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

C79F4DFBDD674C15982EAB89752E9662.description: Gather relevant information from multiple sources

837B586555ED422D9B20D7C94AB889B2.description: Quote or paraphrase the data conclusions of others and avoid plagiarism

9A1F42BF015040739989DD2E5E321AE9.description: Assess the credibility and accuracy of a source

8A371EAC7BCA4ECABBD7C84908736961.description: Determine the relevance of information gathered from print and digital sources

A69B3E0C9DAC4194B6E37E4DB6F2B131.description: Recognize a standard format for a citation

25DDBCE6E29A4854A1C9F62568217901.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

9E0BBA04F7FB4562B9478FC599CCF769.description:
Conduct short research projects that generate focused questions that allow for multiple
avenues of exploration

E866D34687F349C68BBD2F39C0848E53.description: Conduct short research projects that draw on several sources

7C3D012F162A4E35A947C574CCE11BD7.description: Conduct short research projects that answer questions

424FC6FFF99748019D7FF30C3D2356B9.description: Formulate questions that would allow for other avenues of exploration

67EB3361500E4092B8C351C689ECEBCD.description: Draw conclusions about the validity of sources

CE74F31DB53B4136B418EBFB48E268D6.description: Determine which facts/examples best answer a question

AE58FBDDFC9841CBAB788628DDF0DE21.description: Apply appropriate inquiry methods to conduct a research project

1598E7479F074675A7F694DD9146D331.description: Conduct short research projects to answer a question (including a self-generated question), drawing on several sources and generating additional related, focused questions that allow for multiple avenues of exploration.

571A5219079B4131B9E302ABDA63FD74.description: Use technology to present information and ideas

F1A156A3F4D74D868B5D422550631F96.description: Use technology to interact and collaborate with others

70BD137C22FC4D40AD952F98EB20BFD3.description: Use technology (Internet) to produce, revise, edit, and publish writing

12CF3041CEEA4DBD81D26C094C8CFDFE.description: Select technology to present information and ideas

6100C5D6908F44DD84A56F4747C1778A.description: Evaluate the relationship between information presented and ideas expressed

4B0093DEC31A456C9672C165B8735CF7.description: Determine the best technology options for communicating and collaborating with others for an intended purpose

7448BC593C984560BA6950E3B5413135.description:
Determine the best technology tools for producing and publishing writing appropriate to the purpose and
audience

6C4FB5B139594443B41901A73F950CFD.description: Identify publishing and collaboration options that use technology

2E4D9361D9A9482595A1F1122BD62DC8.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and present the relationships between information and ideas efficiently as well as to interact and collaborate with others.

59F305E3F36B4200A13B1CCDECE3E3EC.description: Develop and strengthen writing by trying a new approach

9E03D729827F4D3BB249A37E5A1FF26D.description: Develop and strengthen writing by planning, revising, editing, and rewriting

825CBB9449E9458096BFF7CF1A6435EE.description: Determine how well the focus of audience has been addressed

9E70992A6B204648B1CC514B84CA5B6F.description: Determine how well the focus of the purpose has been addressed

98EA09A3DDC44683AA929D3860CB7451.description: Recognize how to try a new approach

A0882A8283804A44AE72D7423A470B3F.description: Recognize how to plan, revise, edit, and rewrite

BE353AC2471344B1A3809B10F82D207B.description: With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on how well purpose and audience have been addressed.

145998C4B6614B819354C95DDA2A8B9F.description: Write with clear and coherent style

5F7887162F3B4069BE2BD119646D304F.description: Write with clear and coherent organization

BA2A300A4B824A1A9344104DF2EF72CA.description: Write with clear and coherent idea development

5F1DD2BC67C84A4E942022720BA366E4.description: Analyze the reason for writing to decide the task, purpose, and audience

C25E7D30B23B484DBAA354B01477AD4B.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

6C24ED3D67764B65B05B8DB6B2B679B4.description: Write a narrative that leads to a reflective conclusion

A70D4A7D7ADE4EF3B0E2C0263331B461.description: Write a narrative that uses appropriate, precise, descriptive sensory language

E0FE3DA97C8A41B588E557884A168E47.description: Write a narrative that uses a variety of transitions to convey sequence and signal shifts

2C3A116928D54C0E9420EA53F660B85D.description: Write a narrative that uses dialogue, pacing, and description to develop experiences, events, characters

0D57AEC873FB4382BB80A7B2F342737E.description: Write a narrative that establishes a context and point of view

6737AF92404D4EC69DF7E1CDC61A87D2.description: Write a narrative that engages the reader

2D3E63A161F64DBF83980BAD7E8D9580.description: Assemble a conclusion that reflects on experiences and events

57A7EC92B0F44329B467F7BF65718EE5.description: Use precise, descriptive, and sensory language to capture the action and to develop experiences and events

990D0C3B4D364F9FAA4DA1A98CBF1069.description: Analyze the relationships among experiences and events

8B20A7299F544630A02F4930D276E1C4.description: Use a variety of transitions to shift from one setting to another

8B6436A688B640B5B34DA9554954FA92.description: Design and organize event sequences that unfold naturally and logically

EB628F0925974CEBAAC7FFC6D8A3BA5A.description: Identify various points of view in narratives

E194A98A1D564B2BBD2CF262F8FD186F.description: Recognize how authors use sensory details to help readers visualize or sense the action

0872DCF30E2245BABAB0FA1178121220.description: Recognize how authors use description to help readers visualize or sense the action

FEE07D7FD7ED49449F81FFD943F5F3F0.description: Recognize how authors use precise words/phrases to help readers visualize or sense the action

AB6E96B0499F45218FF9BD75F67D7CA5.description: Recognize transition words, phrases, and clauses

27B4410AD0A147E9A505F50F393B1BD5.description: Identify narrative techniques such as dialogue, pacing, description, and reflection

F34A1395389244659647FDD7792854C1.description: Identify various points of view in narratives

BE2B1F8A5A9F465A835A075B173E4E3D.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences.

0101FFE4EC1F4DFDA9B71637824C8281.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to explain concepts and information

C78D24E779C645A2BB48554FB7F78F86.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to convey ideas

F78C692B87724F50BE7DDB1C908CB61F.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic

73C7444685A0427AAC9DAA51A9AABC30.description: Provide an effective, concluding statement or section that supports the topic

9443AF232C2E4F01B07994827ACAB759.description: Establish and maintain a formal style

D5B72004F4694119B9E444084E46CCD3.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary

2DBCE3D6DF1E464DB40CBFCC06BAE2B3.description:
Use appropriate and varied transitions to clarify the relationships between ideas and concepts and create
cohesion

C4EC1D7CA7924FB6A7BA8AC16D0E05AE.description: Apply formatting, graphics, and multimedia to aid comprehension

31310E04274B48BEAA3C926F05F5D611.description: Develop a topic using definitions, concrete details, quotations, examples, and other information

2A4072457EA74E9CAEB92F280629828C.description: Develop a topic with relevant, well-chosen facts

B1AC8A380EE44412AD6C73D63B80A0BD.description: Determine an effective, supportive conclusion for the topic or section

AD4EF39A17184277AACBA81B43754C84.description: Determine precise language and domain-specific vocabulary

814F64CFA8D14116A245C5955150A935.description: Select appropriate and varied transitions to create cohesion and clarify relationships

1A3B84C3150A4AC9B5A0C9227E5B7C11.description:
Analyze and organize relevant content using facts, definitions, concrete details, and quotations to develop the
topic

F734CCE32F3944819A2D43ACF2126290.description: Organize ideas, concepts, and information into broader categories

9E8CCC968FDB47EF9B8A7CFC7E584EF3.description: Identify a conclusion for a topic that follows and supports the information or explanation presented

AAD7D725BEC04AD7B1BCC7627F13EFF2.description: Identify precise language and domain-specific vocabulary

04AADDB6624B4337B02155221006C23E.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content.

1A6E03A941D44DF8A705CD9F14905CBA.description: Write an argument which provides a concluding statement that follows and supports the argument presented

0726E2F1FE6041B8BFC2031F87C4FCB0.description: Write an argument which establishes and maintains a formal style

02947E76F28E454FB389880F3AB7F0DE.description:
Write an argument which uses words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion and clarify relationships among
claim(s), counterclaims, reasons and evidence

81109DD7B7C145D8AC51249C242F6B41.description: Write an argument which demonstrates an understanding of the topic or text

1C1BE310F81146CFBF92C735F69BAA41.description: Write an argument which cites credible and accurate sources of information

13849334191346A7A0EF669CC503195F.description: Write an argument which demonstrates logical organization or reasons and evidence

97D934F0A3B345409DCB6E24E1742A74.description:
Write an argument which introduces claims, acknowledges, and distinguishes claim(s) from alternate or opposing
claims

28F3C1A639BC4E589BBFDE7D8746E52F.description: Write an argument to support claims with clear, logical reasons, and relevant evidence

15C5990FB708442F975E9A081F3327BE.description: Plan a concluding statement following the argument

C0EE19D60A8449D2BD7252E33D046135.description: Create cohesion and clarify relationships among claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence

8E10DF0847F7442DB81A2AAB5376864D.description: Evaluate sources for credibility and accuracy

6C402410F7D3440C917CBB4EFEB0ECA7.description: Build support for claims by distinguishing between relevant and irrelevant evidence

82543B47B2B44F9D997DFA64AB56FA15.description: Build support for claims using logical reasoning and relevant evidence

0D8412225BE04A12AAA1219384EDB686.description: Determine how to introduce claims and acknowledge alternate or opposing claims

613AE956C4B7410D93C4A6E458E60A48.description: Identify and explain a concluding statement

2615DFEAE032451C8E19B291891314B6.description: Identify and explain alternate, counter, or opposing claims

6AA7419FF6FD4D589A0D50B58A2B52C1.description: Identify and explain phrases and clauses that create cohesion and clarify relationships

CE84E8D369254D7BA5AEA2A6F44DC431.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence

E57587A730D348EA976AFCCF1311179E.description: Demonstrate correct use of formal English when speaking

8BE5EACA2EF7410EB4503F4C5209D6F8.description: Adapt speech to a given context or task when speaking

61412ED1B02C4EDFBEB9F42E708B809F.description: Determine if formal or informal speech is appropriate in the context of a given situation

8A7BCEF929D840D9979DDBBA0A70091F.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

DBD439C5E4494041BD32D81BD45D5EC7.description: Integrate multimedia components/visual displays in a presentation to add interest

4479D7CE10BD4CDFB74240316520F732.description: Integrate multimedia components/visual displays in a presentation to strengthen claims and evidence

09B08903C2CE4F77BE9EC19FB818F886.description: Integrate multimedia components/visual displays in a presentation to clarify information

5A3FB932FD5743D0BFA76799C7C0097D.description: Determine when to integrate multimedia and visual displays to add interest

725DA8E66F1448EBAA9319E85FBCD681.description: Determine when to integrate multimedia and visual displays to strengthen claims and evidence

85078BC2339049AD984DDF447E39FDE0.description: Determine when to integrate multimedia and visual display to clarify information

EF467E004C874A98A6A15645183FD473.description: Integrate multimedia and visual displays into presentations to clarify information, strengthen claims and evidence, and add interest.

DF52B529C8054294A704100B86D55F30.description: Present claims and findings emphasizing salient points with well-chosen details

AF0F729ED66148ABB87D149B29044D95.description: Present claims and findings emphasizing salient points with sound, valid reasoning

8B87970A9C354F9EA871B56464F9F15C.description: Present claims and findings emphasizing salient points with relevant evidence

DB60AA651698489D81164179366A6715.description: Organize points and details in a coherent manner

B78FD592E19E4AF490CDF204DEF2FAE0.description: Present claims and findings, emphasizing salient points in a focused, coherent manner with relevant evidence, sound valid reasoning, and well-chosen details; use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation.

E1091127252246B4ACE96C4CDD31FDA8.description: Distinguish between sufficient and insufficient evidence in a speaker’s argument

AD491226F45F484A88AC269B195CA6FF.description: Distinguish between relevant and irrelevant evidence in a speaker’s argument

4D1042FE8033449AA54C92EBA114E5F6.description: Distinguish between sound and unsound reasoning in a speaker’s argument

040E3D5674154214B52A8066379940C3.description: Evaluate the relevance and sufficiency of the speaker’s evidence

8E06A2A8C3B742729ED2A11327810DBC.description: Evaluate the soundness of the speaker’s reasoning

DCCB4D3709D54CAABB0708A3C0D453C3.description: Identify a speaker’s argument and specific claims

6C9CF1BEC4364DC3A1D778393D3E9B1A.description: Define and identify a speaker’s argument and claims

E28739A26BBA4ACF88D73E7D1D859726.description: Delineate a speaker's argument and specific claims, evaluating the soundness of the reasoning and relevance and sufficiency of the evidence and identifying when irrelevant evidence is introduced.

B47EA51F58EE4B96A1F566943D598B87.description: Evaluate the motives behind the presentation of the information

A768E1E174774CD38DEBE1F4824B7B32.description: Analyze the purpose of information presented in diverse media

84653A7458D244218FA3946BED097814.description: Identify the author’s motives for the presentation of information

D1DAC93C4BFB42DE9572DCB0276C82E5.description: Identify the author’s purpose in information presented

1E860FF1F66B44D6877DBFF319DD6654.description: Analyze the purpose of information presented in diverse media and formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively, orally) and evaluate the motives (e.g., social, commercial, political) behind its presentation.

5B68AFF27938419399986D7ABA2ABE97.description: Acknowledge new information posed and use evidence to justify personal viewpoints

E936A776DFB849B59989737347024314.description: Respond to questions and comments with relevant details

8BFF3FAA55734D339301215977973D21.description: Pose relevant questions that connect the ideas of several speakers

67DA0A96C3AD42489C305AD250FE036E.description: Engage in a variety of discussions by listening and sharing acquired and prior knowledge

F476A1AC2403430D882D53FE2A758456.description: Formulate comments, questions, and responses based on evidence, observations, and ideas

0978EF05CA64448A9018643613DA0967.description: Evaluate new information and personal views, as well as the views of others

7839620DD81748DE8D2D336DA2917C91.description: Track progress toward specific goals and deadlines, defining individual roles as needed

AE3C0F7EECE745ED9BBCE576D80F5E47.description: Evaluate personal views and the views of others

51FF42383C0C4AC3A417B992B2569493.description: Synthesize ideas, issues, and arguments to formulate personal opinion and questions for others

351BD66827524378823FE637E0C39E42.description: Analyze texts, issues, and others’ opinions

9DDE3345D0C74E63AA03283539823809.description: Recognize key ideas and new information during discussions

FE8FEEC878C843CD8C2B8B01FE68D711.description: Describe components of a collegial discussion and planning

9324D2CF0B304805AABE2DBB70066E67.description: Identify key ideas from reading material or research

02F4672E29234D55A0FA50B1BADFA157.description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 8 topics, texts, and issues, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.

B8165B3D76084E919042D10AE5D7AEFE.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poems, at the high end of grades 6-8 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

5B7091A0577A46F2BE6AFC8763C62F0C.description: Evaluate how myths, traditional stories, or religious works are rendered new

F9331640023040709CBE9812CCE66981.description: Compare and contrast character types in modern fiction to myth/traditional story/religious work

FF220A49B3F449CD9A639C4863C3E6C4.description: Compare and contrast patterns of events in modern fiction to myth/traditional story/religious work

18EBEFF2791E4159BC0C511B76720304.description: Compare and contrast themes in modern fiction to myth/traditional story/religious work

B71BAEA414D34331A8BD909713212443.description: Analyze how a modern work of fiction draws on themes, patterns of events, or character types from myths, traditional stories, or religious works such as the Bible, including describing how the material is rendered new.

D9FEFB18EB07480894FAFD2B46EF129E.description: Evaluate the outcome/impact of choices made by directors and actors

7E7D5F6687BE478AA11D46F60762A957.description: Analyze the faithfulness or departure between the text of a story or drama and the live or filmed production

EB988DF9CE69459C8312DFDC4E872A3D.description: Compare and contrast the text of a story or drama and the live or filmed production

290C51A48AFE47A6B8E27A71E87BE618.description: Recognize choices directors and actors make

622F906C794549CB8416A6E436338B73.description: Analyze the extent to which a filmed or live production of a story or drama stays faithful to or departs from the text or script, evaluating the choices made by the director or actors.

822CA1E794EE4EE180BC3FB03964F9EE.description: Analyze the techniques the author uses to respond to conflicting evidence

C9A5A3702189491F8B4B83B64F172B07.description: Compare and contrast the author’s evidence and/or viewpoints to conflicting evidence and/or viewpoints

AAE388FDC49E4119B96CC9C86DE69618.description: Identify conflicting evidence or viewpoints presented in a given text

FA17C58E3278468AA4BB45F8FBFA9960.description: Identify evidence the author uses to support his/her characters’ viewpoint/purpose

4946FDCDACAD492A9357B163F5D022E0.description: Determine the author’s point of view or purpose

1134DD26E18E4D1890AA8465C264F9A8.description: Analyze how differences in the points of view of the characters and the audience or reader (e.g., created through the use of dramatic irony) create such effects as suspense or humor.

A1C59FAABC28453E811CCA5E8A7E7262.description: Analyze how the structure of each text contributes to its meaning and style

A60C59E88AAD4DFBA143EBDDBD1CD247.description: Compare and contrast the structure of two texts

ACBAFD68CDE34097AAEFD0D3672256E3.description: Identify structural elements of two or more texts

B14315EA16ED40CE8AA240D63064F990.description: Compare and contrast the structure of two or more texts and analyze how the differing structure of each text contributes to its meaning and style.

F30EB3A95D42482784F0169F8EB92E25.description: Analyze the impact of word choices, analogies, and allusions on meaning and tone

A8014CB548044EE091978D2444EBBB10.description: Determine the figurative and connotative meanings of words and phrases as they are used in the text

DC0ABAE083DE4E6291E59E7FAD60B408.description: Identify specific words that impact meaning and tone

3AF199FA5C2A45B48A280CD5EF1C85D3.description: Identify meaning and tone of a text

B21D19243A2F442D99FE4F88D95518BA.description: Identify figurative and connotative words and phrases

00710783519E42A597ED81DB1684B4F3.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including analogies or allusions to other texts.

5BE6C8491321497DA060D1FF01C2BD0E.description: Analyze lines of dialogue for provoking decisions

6198E647D44D4916B2E182093D2B56AC.description: Analyze lines of dialogue for revealing characters

AF20A76B1CAC40829263C3633E9BE320.description: Analyze lines of dialogue for propelling action

7AE6A5E772E344E6B27BE3CF1A4A691C.description: Analyze how particular lines of dialogue or incidents in a story or drama propel the action, reveal aspects of a character, or provoke a decision.

0EA36327309B40E9A454E0C10E97918E.description: Provide an objective summary of the text

3E0345C7515A449CB1B2DDC71A619229.description: Analyze the relationship between the theme and literary elements of the text

68647DF2517B44E8AF1FA57FA9ED7D44.description: Analyze the development of a theme or central idea over the course of a text

65929FC743C448438793D3D637345950.description: Know the literary elements (characters, setting, plot)

7E7EA69A2DB34C5F85DC30263725DE8A.description: Understand theme and central idea of a text

B77343BED65E428F81F50DBB5D673917.description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text, including its relationship to the characters, setting, and plot; provide an objective summary of the text.

AF745C4C16C7496488A2ED4948175AD2.description: Cite evidence used to make inferences from the text

4CB2A0F3B32F4C11B07893D5804F37DC.description: Evaluate evidence about what most strongly supports key ideas

F6B47626B6AF4E8CA1132C45F4BCE88D.description: Make inferences about what a text says but is not directly stated

066EF7A1D557496084D2CD503D115283.description: Recognize the difference between inference and what is explicitly stated

B5FE9D966068485DBB92366C094C8673.description: Identify evidence that strongly supports the key idea

ECEE6EDA675A4C40A77306352872A5A9.description: Cite the textual evidence that most strongly supports an analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

92CFDF151EF8412192A211BAD1509056.description: Identify and understand integration of knowledge

72DF99EE2D5445078C50BE1CD499FC76.description: Identify and understand craft and structure

6E3EA7AC96084F07941D07980681666F.description: Identify and understand key ideas and details

D67677082EC94815821244D987BAEC08.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literary nonfiction at the high end of the grades 6-8 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

8BDC45CA55C640549C9ED100F21D0D2F.description: Analyze two or more texts for conflicting information as to how the texts disagree in facts or interpretation

288FE89E9E5B4B40B208DF910E787D92.description: Analyze a case in which two or more texts provide conflicting information on the same topic and identify where the texts disagree on matters of fact or interpretation.

123E86ADB24F4337BC9A7AC70B20AD94.description: Analyze a case in which two or more texts provide conflicting information on the same topic and identify where the texts disagree on matters of fact or interpretation.

B533260806E64C66BA55E0224735E75B.description: Evaluate an argument in a text based on sound reasoning, relevance, and sufficient evidence

D0F20ADC20F44783942B7012BD1834AC.description: Classify evidence as sufficient/insufficient in informational text

3D1651E2B96B468982234C4235C54AE8.description: Classify reasoning as sound/unsound in informational text

8C95DC9DD0D54FBDB10DEDA249A84476.description: Classify evidence as relevant/irrelevant in informational text

F3E4364882E944DC8E86F3DF598C3398.description: Delineate the argument and specific claims of a text

9E62155674B44118A311B12B44844B56.description: Define and identify sound/unsound reasoning in informational text

6442A4E5BDF44FC794549FA2EDA9FFEF.description: Define and identify sufficient/insufficient evidence in informational text

51DCCD5E7ED14C67AEAE40D7E8AF1DC5.description: Define and identify relevant/irrelevant evidence in informational text

712471E139E8486EA22613C0BF887E8E.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient; recognize when irrelevant evidence is introduced.

29A77859A3844E80BED5E931D95AD8FE.description: Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of using multimedia in a presentation

DA788879ACCD4994B8F5F5463A9D9BEC.description: Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of using video in a presentation

94EFA8942A9942768078414B858BAAEE.description: Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of using digital in a presentation

72AD07A0AC7948A09A75856AD171BDB6.description: Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of using print in a presentation

960A5D153EA748F18E0B671237AA9AE9.description: Identify different mediums including print, digital, video, and multimedia

DC91BA8F3152464FB1302765B8C86D50.description: Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of using different mediums (e.g., print or digital text, video, multimedia) to present a particular topic or idea.
